title: Which artist sang the song 'Hey Jude'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hey Jude is a song written by BeaTle, Paul McCartney. He wrote it while on a ride to fello BeaTle, John Lennon’s House. John was divorcing his wife Cynthia and Paul wrote it as a soothing message to their son, Julian. But rather than sing “Hey Jules,” he instead chose to disguise it as “Hey Jude.” There is a Line in the song that Paul wanted to change. ”The ‘movement’ you need is on your shoulder.” Saying to John, “I have to change that. I meant to say ‘mo-ment!’” To which John replied “You WON’T, you know! That’s the best line in the bloody song! And there you have it. It may have been serendipity, but it is now a line that has been famously sung for fifty years! A little trivia- A line that snuck past the censors. Toward the end of the song, in the line where Paul sings “Remember… to let her under your skin. Ah…” Paul hit a wrong chord on the piano and said “Fuckin’ Hell!” Although they tried to bury it as best they could in the piano track, it is there and you can hear it.

The famous song “Hey Jude” was written by the Beatles.
